at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server.connections

Class PhoneConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server.connections.Connection
      • at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.server.connections.PhoneConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class PhoneConnection
extends Connection
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class is used to communicate with a phone via a TCP-connection (see Connection class for more information on the basic functionalities).
    It holds the reference to the CarConnection of a linked car (if any) in order to be able to forward information such as control-data to it. It is also able to request the establishment of a link between this phone and a car.
    This class provides the means for a linked car to send data (e.g. sensor-data) to the phone.
    Author:
    Boeck

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhoneConnection

        public PhoneConnection(java.net.Socket connection,
                       java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<QueueElement> operationQueue)
        Used to initialize this class with a Socket and a LinkedBlockingQueue for communicating with the main-thread.
        Parameters:
        connection - the Socket for this class. Needs to be pre-configured (priority, read-timeout, etc.), since this class does not provide means to configure the Socket.
        operationQueue - this LinkedBlockingQueue is used to communicate with the main-thread.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Returns:
        the phones ID.

      • getLinkRequestId

        public long getLinkRequestId()
        Returns:
        Returns the cars ID that this phone wants to connect to, or 0 if there has not been any request yet.

      • getLinkedCar

        public CarConnection getLinkedCar()
        Returns:
        Returns the CarConnection that this phone is linked to, or null.

        Sets the CarConnection, to link this device to the given car.
        Parameters:
        linkedCar - the CarConnection to link to.

      • closeConnection

        protected void closeConnection()
        Tries to gracefully close the connection, set the closeConnection-flag to true and informs the main-thread about this event through the operationQueue.
        Also, the linked car (if any) is informed about the termination of the link, by setting its linked phone to null.
        Overrides:
        closeConnection in class Connection

      • updateListeners

        protected void updateListeners(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> decodedDataset)
        Description copied from class: Connection
        This method informs all registered listeners about incoming data.
        Specified by:
        updateListeners in class Connection
        Parameters:
        decodedDataset - the HashMap that contains the incoming message.

      • processConnectRequest

        private void processConnectRequest(java.lang.Object carId)
        If the passed argument can be parsed to a long and is greater than 0, linkRequestId is set accordingly and the main-thread is informed about the request. If it is -1, the current link, if any, is terminated.
        Parameters:
        carId - the cars ID to be linked to, or -1 to terminate an existing link.

      • processRemainingData

        private void processRemainingData(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> decodedDataset)
        Processes all parts of an incoming message that should be forwarded to the linked car, if any, and forwards them accordingly.
        Parameters:
        decodedDataset - the HashMap that contains the message.

      • register

        protected java.lang.String register()
        Description copied from class: Connection
        This method waits until the connected device has sent identification information. It also requests identification every 5 seconds that no identification information has been received. While waiting for identification of the connected device, all other received information is discarded.
        If identification has been received, the main-thread is informed about the event. In this case, the connected device must not yet be informed about the success of the operation. This is handled by the main-thread in order to be able to conform with the Servers whitelist.
        Overrides:
        register in class Connection
        Returns:
        the received id

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
